snippet: The leak, off the coast of Scotland, is losing the French company $1.5 million a day in earnings and generating another $1 million a day in costs.
abstract: French oil company Total says a natural gas leak off the coast of Scotland in the North Sea is costing it $2.5 million a day and that it is too early to say when it can be stopped; cost of stopping leak could reach $200 million if two relief wells are drilled, as planned.
